name: Q&A Session - No Labels
description: Plain text Q&A without explicit speaker labels - tests heuristic detection
transcript:
What made you decide to pursue this career path?

I always loved building things. As a kid, I would take apart every electronic device in the house. My parents were not thrilled, but it sparked something in me.

When did you realize you could make a living from it?

Probably in college. I built a small app that helped students find study groups, and people actually started using it. That's when I thought, maybe I can do this professionally.

What advice would you give to someone just starting out?

Don't wait for permission. Build something. Ship it. Get feedback. Repeat. Most successful people I know didn't ask if they were ready. They just started.

What's the biggest mistake you've made in your career?

Waiting too long to hire. I tried to do everything myself for the first two years. By the time I brought on help, I was completely burned out. You can't scale alone.
